title: Space Force reshapes for a new era of competition
summary: The U.S. Space Force is making organizational moves that the industry should closely monitor. These changes, spearheaded by Chief of Space Operations Gen. Chance Saltzman, aim to amplify the voices […]

title: Historic flooding possible as TS Debby bears down on southeastern United States
summary: Tropical rainfall and training bands, it's going to be a soggy mess.

title: Indian astronauts to start training for ISS mission
summary: Two Indian astronauts will soon start training at NASA’s Johnson Space Center, with one of them flying to the International Space Station on an upcoming private astronaut mission.

title: GAO Questions Gateway’s Mass, Schedule
summary: The Government Accountability Office wants NASA to document and communicate a mass management plan for the Gateway lunar space station before the next program review in September. The first two […]

title: SpaceX launches 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg Space Force Base
summary: The launch comes following a scrub for weather of the NG-21 mission at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. Liftoff of the Starlink 11-1 mission happened at 12:24 a.m. PDT (3:24 a.m. EDT, 0724 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E).

title: Science and supplies fly on Falcon 9, Cygnus NG-21
summary: For the second time in 2024, Northrop Grumman’s Cygnus spacecraft will deliver a bounty of science experiments and cargo to the crew aboard the International Space Station (ISS). The CRS NG-21 mission dodged the weather that scrubbed it on Saturday, with a Sunday lift off on a Falcon 9 from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

title: NASA and SpaceX launch a Northrop Grumman Cygnus spacecraft to the International Space Station
summary: The mission, dubbed NG-21, will be the second out of three planned launches of a Cygnus spacecraft onboard a Falcon 9 rocket. Liftoff is set for Sunday, Aug. 4, at 11:02 a.m. EDT (1502 UTC).
